newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks leap 2.26 PCT as bonds welcomed.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks leap 2.26 PCT as bonds welcomed.

text.p: Thai stocks leapt 2.26 percent late on Tuesday as investors bought across the board after the government approved a plan to issue 100 billion baht in zero coupon bonds to help the ailing property sector, brokers said.
The index jumped 2.26 percent at 0853 GMT, up 15.86 points to 719.18 and climbed further after that to a day's high of 719.77.

"The buying in almost every sector resulted from improving market sentiment after the Thai cabinet approved the zero coupon bonds. Buying is focused on the banking sector at the moment," said Busaba Kunasirin of Chao Phya Finance and Securities.
